page.title: 15LIFE STYLES 5
page.content: We went into one of the three village shops and talked to a lady who had worked there for 6 years. She gets up at 6.30am but does not have any breakfast. The shop opens at 8.30am and closes at 5.30pm. She prefers the Â£ coin to the Â£ note as it is easier for counting in the shop. The lady gave us some prices of items in the shop, eg. bread 46p, butter 55p, cheese Â£1.40 per lb., flour 62p and oranges at 13p each. A retired man in the village wakes up at 7.30am. His hobbies are bowls, gardening and photography. He has lived in a bungalow for the past 5 years, and likes the area. He dis- likes the Â£1 coin but does like the 20p coin. For breakfast he eats egg, bacon and toast.
